answers.answer: It in all honesty is absolutely best to go FULL term. All sorts of problems can occur at a drop of a dime. Regardless of how the pregnancy has gone. Plus "from experience" only thing that is positive to come from trying to naturally induce, unless baby is ready, is causing pain, or stress on your body, & possible the baby. When it's the most important time to rest, & conserve your energy! Good luck Momma! Fyi. My first daughter was born 36 week's, no problems after. I was medically induced because of preeclampsia. She was 8lb 6oz.
Just let your baby come when she wants to... but being 37 weeks u will have a healthy baby

question: What can happen if my baby is born at 37 weeks, I wanna induce my labor naturally by sex, massages, and stuff like that but what can be the worst that happens? My pregnancy has been healthy.
title: babies at 37 weeks..
